metadata.Title: CVE-2022-3650 on Ubuntu 23.10 (mantic) - medium
metadata.Description:
A privilege escalation flaw was found in Ceph. Ceph-crash.service allows alocal attacker to escalate privileges to root in the form of a crash dump,and dump privileged information.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-3650` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ceph - 17.2.6-0ubuntu1
ceph-base - 17.2.6-0ubuntu1
ceph-common - 17.2.6-0ubuntu1
ceph-fuse - 17.2.6-0ubuntu1
ceph-grafana-dashboards - 17.2.6-0ubuntu1
ceph-immutable-object-cache - 17.2.6-0ubuntu1
ceph-mds - 17.2.6-0ubuntu1
ceph-mgr - 17.2.6-0ubuntu1
ceph-mgr-cephadm - 17.2.6-0ubuntu1
ceph-mgr-dashboard - 17.2.6-0ubuntu1
ceph-mgr-diskprediction-local - 17.2.6-0ubuntu1
ceph-mgr-k8sevents - 17.2.6-0ubuntu1
ceph-mgr-modules-core - 17.2.6-0ubuntu1
ceph-mgr-rook - 17.2.6-0ubuntu1
ceph-mon - 17.2.6-0ubuntu1
ceph-osd - 17.2.6-0ubuntu1
ceph-prometheus-alerts - 17.2.6-0ubuntu1
ceph-resource-agents - 17.2.6-0ubuntu1
ceph-volume - 17.2.6-0ubuntu1
cephadm - 17.2.6-0ubuntu1
cephfs-mirror - 17.2.6-0ubuntu1
cephfs-shell - 17.2.6-0ubuntu1
crimson-osd - 17.2.6-0ubuntu1
libcephfs-java - 17.2.6-0ubuntu1
libcephfs-jni - 17.2.6-0ubuntu1
libcephfs2 - 17.2.6-0ubuntu1
librados2 - 17.2.6-0ubuntu1
libradosstriper1 - 17.2.6-0ubuntu1
librbd1 - 17.2.6-0ubuntu1
librgw2 - 17.2.6-0ubuntu1
libsqlite3-mod-ceph - 17.2.6-0ubuntu1
python3-ceph - 17.2.6-0ubuntu1
python3-ceph-argparse - 17.2.6-0ubuntu1
python3-ceph-common - 17.2.6-0ubuntu1
python3-cephfs - 17.2.6-0ubuntu1
python3-rados - 17.2.6-0ubuntu1
python3-rbd - 17.2.6-0ubuntu1
python3-rgw - 17.2.6-0ubuntu1
radosgw - 17.2.6-0ubuntu1
rbd-fuse - 17.2.6-0ubuntu1
rbd-mirror - 17.2.6-0ubuntu1
rbd-nbd - 17.2.6-0ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ceph package in mantic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '17.2.6-0ubuntu1').
